intro: Psychotria heterosticta subsp. ivindoensis, commonly known as the Ivindo psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of the central African region, particularly in the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but have a mild, sometimes bitter taste. This species is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
